modules.description: Provides operations to create, manipulate, and convert POSIX time spans represented as days and picoseconds. Supports arithmetic operations, rounding, truncation, and conversions between integer/float seconds and picoseconds. Used for precise time duration calculations in systems requiring POSIX-compliant time handling.

Provides functions to convert between POSIX timestamps and date-time values, parse and format RFC 3339 timestamps, and generate locale-independent human-readable time strings. Operates on a type representing timestamps with picosecond precision and time zone offsets. Used for precise time synchronization, log timestamp formatting, and cross-platform time data exchange.

Provides functions to retrieve the current POSIX time, clock period, and time zone offset, along with low-level time representations in days and picoseconds. Operates with types such as Ptime.t, Ptime.span, and time offsets in seconds. Used for accessing system time values that may be adjusted by external factors like daylight saving changes or manual clock updates.

Encapsulates POSIX time spans with operations for arithmetic, rounding, and conversion between days, picoseconds, and seconds. Supports precise duration calculations using integer and float representations. Enables conversion between different time units and truncation of time values. Can compute time differences, adjust durations, and format results for system-level time operations.
